testcase.brief: Lan ports work with trunk mode, check lan ports native-vlan
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
Laptop1 connect to lan port eth1 Lan ports work with trunk mode
Test Procedure:
1. Enable mgt0 dhcp/dns server 2. Lan port works with trunk mode, check lan ports mode, vlan ID. Result1 3. Check allowed vlan list, vlan-id-check flag. Result2 4. Laptop1 connect to eth1, check HW ARL table (mac-table). Result3 5. Check laptop ip . Result4 6. Configure mgt0 native-vlan as 10 7. Check lan ports native-vlan Result5 9. Configure mgt0.1 vlan 10, enable dhcp, dns server, configure ip address, ip-pool mgt0.1 ip as 10.10.10.1 mgt0.1 vlan as 10 ip-pool as 10.10.10.10-10.10.10.99 8. Laptop1 connect to eth1, check laptop1 ip address Result6

step.desc: config lan ports eth1 with access mode, eth2 with trunk mode, check lan ports mode, native-vlan-id and vlan-check-id
step.telnet: -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access" -v "interface eth2 mode bridge-802.1q" -v "show lan port-config"

step.desc: check allowed vlan list with default
br1.vpc1 connect to lan ports eth1, dhclient retrieve ip address
br1.vpc1 show ip address got from mgt0 dhcp client

step.setvar: echo $(echo $(echo $(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac.tmp} | cut -d : -f1)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac.tmp} | cut -d : -f2,3)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac.tmp} | cut -d : -f4,5)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac.tmp} | cut -d : -f6)) | tr "A-F" "a-f")

step.desc: Configure mgt0 native-vlan, Configure mgt0.x, vlan same with mgt0 native-vlan
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: check allowed vlan list with default
br1.vpc2 connect to lan port eth2, dhclient retrieve ip address
br1.vpc2 got from mgt0.1 dhcp server

step.setvar: echo $(echo $(echo $(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac.tmp} | cut -d : -f1)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac.tmp} | cut -d : -f2,3)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac.tmp} | cut -d : -f4,5)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac.tmp} | cut -d : -f6)) | tr "A-F" "a-f")
